node.text: If you deny climate change, what else do you deny? Science has changed your life for the better, so I don't understand what the issue is!

node.title: A Message To All Climate Change Deniers

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by @climatebriefings on August 23, 2021. May be an image of body of water and text.

node.text:
If you live in Phoenix, Arizona, I’d move ASAP. 🌍🔥✊❤️
*
*
*
@climatebriefings

node.text:
It rained on the summit of Greenland. Rain measurements weren’t available because THEY NEVER HAD ANY REASON TO PUT RAIN MEASURING EQUIPMENT THERE!!! 🌍🔥✊❤️

*
*
@climatebriefings

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by @climatebriefings on August 20, 2021 tagging @gretathunberg. May be an image of 1 person, child, standing, outdoors and text that says 'SKOLSTREJK FOR KLIMATET 1'.

node.text:
From @gretathunberg 🌍🔥✊❤️
・・・
”We kids most often don’t do what you tell us to do. We do as you do. And since you grown-ups don’t give a damn about my future, I won’t either. My name is Greta and I’m in ninth grade. And I am school striking for the climate until election day.” 

This is what I wrote exactly 3 years ago - August 20th 2018 - during the first day of the school strike. 3 years later I am still here, but alongside millions from all over the world.
Since the first school strike the world has emitted over 120 billion tonnes of CO2. The changes necessary are still nowhere in sight. The climate crisis has still never once been treated as a crisis. But people are waking up and demanding climate justice. And we will always continue the fight for our future and present. We simply have no other choice. #FridaysForFuture

THIS IS TONY, HE ONCE SAW SOMETHING ON THE INTERNET ABOUT YOUR FIELD OF EXPERTISE AND IS GOING TO SPEND ETERNITY LECTURING YOU ON IT. 110اا11 川‎'‎.

Photo shared by @climatebriefings on August 17, 2021 tagging @lakotalaw. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'Water cuts are coming to Arizona and Nevada after the US declared the first-ever Colorado River water shortage Morgan McFall-Johnsen Aug 16, 2021, 9:38 PM f'.

node.text:
From @lakotalaw 🌍🔥✊❤️
・・・
For the first time ever, the US federal government has declared a water shortage on the Colorado River.

That's because Lake Mead, the nation's largest reservoir, is lower than it's ever been. It provides water to 25 million people across Arizona, Nevada, California, and Mexico, but as of Monday it's at just 1,067 feet above sea level — about 35% full.

The federal water-shortage declaration means that Arizona and Nevada will face mandatory water cut-backs in January. The cuts will mostly affect farmers in Arizona; the state will lose about one-fifth of the water it normally gets from the river, according to The Associated Press.

"It's very significant," Brad Udall, senior water and climate scientist at Colorado State University, told CNN. "It's something that those of us in the climate community have been worried about for over a decade, based on declining flows due to climate change." From @mniwiconi
・・・

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by @climatebriefings on August 14, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'PRIE perannum in advance WARKWORTH, WEDNESDAY AUGUST 14, 1912. 3d per Copy. Science Notes and News. COAL CONSUMPTION AFFECT- ING CLIMATE. The furnaces of the world are now burning about 2,000,000,000 tons of coal a year. When this is burned, uniting with oxygen, it adds about 7,000,000,000 tons of carbon dioxide to the atmosphere yearly. This tends to make the air a more effective blan- ket for the carth and to raise its temperature. The effect may be con- siderable in a few centuries.'.

node.text:
Every day we wait, we make things irreversibly worse. From @climatehuman 🌍🔥✊❤️

*
*
@climatebriefings

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021 tagging @wordsfromablackwoman. May be an image of text.

node.text:
From @wordsfromablackwoman 🌍🔥✊❤️
・・・
Ignoring climate change will undo our Social Justice work. 

Climate change is one of the most urgent crises we face today. Yes, there are a lot of other things going down, but if we don’t swiftly address how we tackle climate change, there may be no point of fighting for social change as we may not have a planet well enough to see the fruits of our activism labour.

The result of climate change impacts certain pockets of society more than others. I’m in one of those pockets. 

Corporate greed has drastically accelerated the devastation that climate change brings. Natural disasters are becoming the norm, and let’s face it; we aren’t ever going to win against Mother Nature. 

I’ve recently become a Patron of @jo_lorenz (AWESOME WOMAN) and this week I got involved in a Q&A about Climate Change. 

I talk about this in my latest article plus what we can all do now. 

Swipe left for the cheat sheet ⏩⏩⏩

Link in bio 💚

#LetsTalkAboutSociety #SelfReflectionSunday #BlackSolidarity
#LetsTalkAboutRacism #UnityandSupport
#BlackLivesMatter #BLM #QualityTime #Racism #RacismInSociety #Inequality #Injustice #BlackVoices 
#WordsFromABlackWoman #Blog #FightingForChange #Unity #BlackAuthor #Equality #AntiRacism #Education
#ClimateChange #SocialJustice

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021 tagging @wordsfromablackwoman. May be an image of text.
Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says 'What can you do now to make a difference to Climate Change? @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.

Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INFLUENCE PUBLIC POLICY You hold more power than you realise. Lobby your government to introduce policies based on climate science. Communicate the impact of climate change on the vulnerable to amplify their (our) voices. @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.

Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'TAKE ACTION IN YOUR COMMUNITY What ever happened to love thy neighbour? Coming together at the local community level will help see real changes you and your family can benefit from quickly. @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.

Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'SUPPORT EXISTING CLIMATE CHANGE ORGANISATIONS Donate to those who have dedicated years of work into science and research. These solution builders are integral in this fight. @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.

Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'POWER UP ON PLANTS Reduce your meat intake. Meat and dairy production is responsible for 14% of global climate-changing emissions. @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.

Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'LEAVE THE CAR KEYS AT HOME Walk, run, cycle, bus it, train it There are lots of different ways to travel. Motor vehiles= Pollution Pure and simple. @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.

Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'STAYCATIONS ARE ON THE RISE That's not by accident! Discover the beauty of your surroundings. The UK is no Caribbean island, but there is plenty to do on these shores. recently experienced one of my best girl S trips and we were in Kent! @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.
Photo by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'SAVE ENERGY AT HOME Turn off lights Unplug appliances Insulate your gaff Monitor your usage @WORDSFROMABLACKWOMAN'.
